intro: Gastrolychnis apetala var. nuda, commonly known as the naked-flowered gastrolychnis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that lack petals, giving it its common name. Its stems are usually hairy and can grow to a moderate height. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in humid, tropical environments.
